p: Seasonal influenza A and B viruses circulate worldwide, infecting 5–10% of adults and 20–30% of children annually [36], and these viruses are responsible for up to half a million deaths every year. In Taiwan, an island-wide laboratory-based surveillance network of 11 clinical virology laboratories was established in 2000 under coordination of the Taiwan Centers for Disease Control (CDC) and this network has substantially contributed to the control of influenza virus infections [37].
